page.title: 08Education in Beckermet
page.content: Almost all the children between the ages of 4 and 11 attend the local village Primary school. Beckermet C.E. Primary School was opened in 1965. It was extended in 1975 to accomodate the children from the next village of Calderbridge when their school was closed. It is a Church Aided school and the villagers and the Church shared the building costs. There are 90 children on roll, in the care of 4 teachers including the Headmistress. The meals are cooked on the premises by 3 Kitchen staff and there are 2 Dinner Ladies.The children are from a wide catchment area and many are transported to and from school by bus or car. The children are generally bright, articulate, inquisitive and enthusiastic.At the age of 11 they continue their education at either Wyndham School, Egremont, St. Bees Public School or Keswick School.
